	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In February 2015 the Company opened a magnificent store in the Miami Design District;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	business case.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	The Company introduced new signage to the Colombo and Abu Dhabi stores, which opened last year.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	On December&nbsp;26, 2015 (Boxing Day), the Company opened a new store in the Thurrock retail park in London, which is an area with a significant footfall, in a corner location. The store, which is more than 800 square
	meters and which has a revised layout that was specifically designed for the product matrix and implementation of all the Retail&nbsp;&amp; Marketing mix, is providing astonishing results in terms of sales.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company opened 112
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	stores within last year, including 14 new mono brand stores and 98 new galleries, reaching 181
	stores and 457 galleries worldwide. Most of the new gallery openings are in the EMEA region, where, according to the distribution strategy, some former
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	galleries have become
<I>
	Editions
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	retail concept has been also fine-tuned: a full set of new Display System items has replaced the old concept in order
	to ensure an engaging shopping experience even in a shop-in-shop environment like our galleries.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Last year the Company also completed the
	rationalization process for the Directly Operated Stores (&#147;DOS&#148;) network: 4 Divani&nbsp;&amp; Divani stores in Italy were closed. The Company has closed 23 unprofitable stores (mostly in Western Europe) in less than 2 years. The latest
	closures enabled us to reach the appropriate distribution environment, which will help maximize efficiency and profitability of the opening plan for this year. Current DOS distribution is based on 57 POS, out of 1.140 POS Worldwide.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	26
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D190845D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company grants continued effort and investment to the development of efficient and practical
	selling tools. In 2015 the Company was finally able to set up a digital library comprised of the entire
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	retail collection: each product model (sofas, beds, furnishing, etc.) has been modelled in a 3D file format and the full
	list is available for downloading through the most used platform on the web (3D Warehouse, formerly Sketch up). As a result, Natuzzi is now, by far, the most represented furniture companies within the platform brand portfolio. This will hopefully
	help to address the interior decorator community in order to increase business in a still almost unexploited sector for the Group.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<A NAME="D190845D20F_HTM_TOC190845_17">
</A>
	Markets
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group markets its products internationally as well as in Italy. Thanks to its international presence, the seasonality
	does not significantly influence the Group&#146;s operations. Outside Italy, the Group sells its furniture, on a wholesale basis, to major retailers and, on a retail basis, to furniture stores. In 1990, the Group began selling its
	leather-upholstered products in Italy and abroad through franchised
<I>
	Divani&nbsp;&amp; Divani by Natuzzi
</I>
	and
<I>
	Natuzzi
</I>
	(now
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	) furniture stores. Since 2001, the Group has also sold its furniture through directly owned
<I>
	Natuzzi
</I>
	(now
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	) stores and
<I>
	Divani&nbsp;&amp; Divani by Natuzzi
</I>
	stores. In 2005 the Group introduced the
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	to the U.S. market, and it continues to be sold in the Americas through galleries and
	concessions. The
<I>
	Leather Editions
</I>
	product line targets a similar customer to
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	and was introduced in markets outside the Americas in 2010 and also is sold through galleries and concessions. As part of the Business Plan,
	the Group has started its plan to re-label the
<I>
	Leather Editions
</I>
	portfolio of products as
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	to capitalize on the strength of the &#147;Natuzzi&#148; name and streamline its offerings. Consequently, the
<I>
	Leather
	Editions
</I>
	stores, including those stores located in China, will be gradually rebranded worldwide into
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	points of sales. The
<I>
	Italsofa
</I>
	product line was introduced in 2007 with the intent of competing with low-priced
	competitors. In 2013, the Group decided not to make further investments in the
<I>
	Italsofa
</I>
	. All the
<I>
	Italsofa
</I>
	models thus far developed will be progressively absorbed by the Group&#146;s other product line offerings. In October 2013, the
	Group officially launched Re-vive, its innovative performance recliner, now the
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	iconic product, and began its distribution in the first half of 2014 in 25 markets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company has almost completed its commercial and distribution re-organization in all its commercial regions, in order to better exploit
	market opportunities all over the world. This reorganization includes expanding its retail presence in large department stores to increase visibility of the Natuzzi brand&#146;s product lines as well as establishing a separate business unit, aimed
	at generating sales volumes and developing new key accounts through its private label offerings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following tables show the number of
	Group stores and galleries as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 according to our principal geographic areas.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	1)
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Includes the United States, Canada and Latin America (including Brazil) (collectively, the &#147;Americas&#148;).

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<I>
	*
</I>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
	The concessions are store-in-store concept selling Natuzzi Italia products, and are managed directly by a subsidiary of the Company located in the United Kingdom. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016 there were 9 Natuzzi Italia
	concessions, all located in United Kingdom.
</I>
</TD>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Includes the United States, Canada and Latin America (including Brazil) (collectively, the &#147;Americas&#148;).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The &#147;Natuzzi&#148; brand includes the Group&#146;s three lines of product:
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	,
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	and
<I>
	Natuzzi Re-Vive.
</I>
	Figures for 2012 and 2013 have been reclassified accordingly.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Starting from the second half of 2014, upholstered net sales under the &#147;Natuzzi&#148; brand also includes net sales of
	beds sold under the
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	line
<I>
	.
</I>
</P>

	2.1

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Includes the United States, Canada and Latin America (including Brazil) (collectively, the &#147;Americas&#148;).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The &#147;Natuzzi&#148; brand includes the Group&#146;s three lines of product:
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	,
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	and
<I>
	Natuzzi Re-Vive.
</I>
	Figures for 2012 and 2013 have been reclassified accordingly.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Starting from the second half of 2014, upholstered net sales under the &#147;Natuzzi&#148; brand also includes net sales of
	beds sold under the
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	line
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	1. The Americas.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In 2015, net sales of leather and fabric-upholstered furniture in the United States and the rest of the Americas (including Brazil) were
	&#128;181.3&nbsp;million, up 6,1% from &#128;171.0&nbsp;million, reported in 2014, and the number of seats sold decreased by 14,5%, from 842,263 in 2014 to 719,959 in 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group&#146;s principal customers are major retailers. The Group advertises its products to retailers and, recently, to consumers in the
	United States, Canada, and Latin America (excluding Brazil) both directly and through the use of various marketing tools. The Group also relies on its network of sales representatives and on the furniture fairs held at its High Point, North Carolina
	offices each spring and fall to promote its products. The Group also takes part in the Las Vegas Furniture Fair.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	29
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D190845D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group&#146;s sales in the United States, Canada and Latin America (excluding Brazil) were
	handled by Natuzzi Americas until June&nbsp;30, 2010. Starting July&nbsp;1, 2010, as a part of a general reorganization of the Group&#146;s commercial activities, worldwide third-party sales have been handled by the parent company, Natuzzi S.p.A.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Natuzzi Americas maintains offices in High Point, North Carolina, the heart of the most important furniture manufacturing and
	distribution region in the United States, and provides Natuzzi S.p.A with agency services. The staff at High Point provides customer service, trademarks and products promotions, credit collection assistance, and generally acts as the customers
	contact for the Group. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, the High Point North Carolina operation had 52 employees. In addition such Company has 24 independent sales representatives.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All of our commercial activities in Brazil are overseen from our Salvador de Bahia facility. The Group&#146;s commercial structure in Brazil
	has been reinforced by an increase in personnel, from 12 representatives in 2012 to 23 as of the end of 2015. Sales in Brazil in 2015 decreased by 11.9% from &#128;10.7&nbsp;million in 2014 to &#128;9.5&nbsp;million in 2015 due to the work on better
	sales and mix to increase margins.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In July 2014, the Group reached an agreement to sell the Pojuca plant to a Brazilian company. In
	particular, a rental agreement with a sale-promise clause was signed, followed by a preliminary sale agreement signed in February 2015. The collection of the agreed sale price, for a total consideration of approximately &#128;4.0&nbsp;million, was
	completed in January 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In 2015, we opened 23 new
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	galleries in the Americas region (of which, 4 in South
	America), 3 new
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	stores in South America, 6
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	galleries and 5
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia stores
</I>
	(North and Central America)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As noted above, in February 2014, we opened a new, directly-operated Natuzzi Italia flagship store in New York City on Madison Avenue, with
	the aim of anchoring the Group&#146;s expansion in the New York-Connecticut-New Jersey Tristate area. We closed our New York City store located in Soho in June 2014. In addition, as of March&nbsp;31, 2016, there were also 18 Natuzzi Italia stores
	operating in the Americas that are owned by local dealers (11 in the United States and Canada, 7 in Latin America). Furthermore, as of the same date, there were 11 Natuzzi Editions stores, all located in Brazil.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	2. EMEA
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During 2015, the
	Group continued to consolidate its position in Western Europe, and increase its presence in Eastern Europe, the Middle East and Africa (collectively, &#147;EMEA&#148;), by investing in stores and galleries. Net sales of leather and
	fabric-upholstered furniture in EMEA (including Italy) increased by 4.9% in 2015 to &#128;193.9&nbsp;million (from &#128;184.8&nbsp;million in 2014), with the number of seats sold increasing by 3.8%, from 644.681 in 2014 to 668.891 in 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	2a) Italy
</B>
	. Since 1990, the Group has sold its upholstered products within Italy principally through the
<I>
	Divani&nbsp;&amp; Divani by
	Natuzzi
</I>
	franchised network of furniture stores. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016 there were 75
<I>
	Divani&nbsp;&amp; Divani by Natuzzi
</I>
	stores, and three
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	stores located in Italy. The Group directly owns 15 of these stores,
	including the three stores operating under the
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	name.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	2b) Europe (Outside Italy).
</B>
	The Group expands into
	other European markets mainly through stores (local dealers, franchisees or directly operated stores). As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, 72 stores were operating in Europe: 5 under the
<I>
	Divani&nbsp;&amp; Divani by Natuzzi
</I>
	, all located in Portugal;
	64 were under the
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	name (9 in Spain, 9 in France, 7 in Russia, 5 in Switzerland, 6 in the United Kingdom, 4 in each of Poland and the Czech Republic, 3 in Cyprus, 2 in each of Hungary and Ukraine, and 1 in each of Armenia,
	Bosnia, Croatia, Estonia, Germany, Latvia, Malta, Romania, Serbia, Azerbaijan, Kosovo, Turkey and Slovenia) and 3 Natuzzi Editions. Of these stores, 19 were directly owned by the Group as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 and all were operated under the
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	name: 9 in Spain, 5 in Switzerland, 4 in the United Kingdom and 1 in Germany. Apart from the
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	stores, the Group also operates 9 concessions in the United Kingdom.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	30
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D190845D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Given the size of the Russian market and its strategic relevance to the Group&#146;s future
	growth, a local representative office was opened in Moscow in February 2010, with the aim of managing sales, marketing and customer service for Russia and the Ukraine, and to supervise the opening of new single-brand stores in the Russian market.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	2c) Middle East&nbsp;&amp; Africa.
</B>
	As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, the Group had a total of 26
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	stores in the
	Middle East&nbsp;&amp; Africa region: 8 in India, 5 in Israel, 3 in Saudi Arabia, 2 each in United Arab Emirates, and one each in Algeria, C&ocirc;te d&#146;Ivoire, Egypt, Lebanon, Qatar, Jordan, Libya and Sri Lanka. In addition 2 under the
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	were operating
<I>
	,
</I>
	all located in Israel.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In January 2012, following the worsening of the European
	Union&#146;s diplomatic relations with Iran and Syria, the Company decided to cease all business relations with these two countries.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	No
	impairment issue arose following the cessation of business relations with those two countries.&nbsp;The Group had no sales in Iran or Syria in 2015, 2014 and 2013. Our prior interests and activities in Iran or Syria are not a material investment
	risk, either from an economic, financial or reputational point of view.&nbsp;The Group has not had, nor does it plan to have, any commercial contacts with the governments of Iran or Syria, or with entities controlled by such governments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group has never generated sales in Sudan or North Korea or Cuba
<B>
	.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	3. Asia-Pacific Region.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In 2015, net sales of leather and fabric-upholstered furniture in the Asia-Pacific region increased by 16,0% to &#128;61.9&nbsp;million form
	&#128;53.3&nbsp;million from in 2014, and the number of seats sold decreased 11.9%, from 175,351 in 2014 to 154.409 in 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Natuzzi
	Trading (Shanghai) Co., Ltd. acts as a regional office and manages the commercial part of the business throughout the region. Furthermore, the Group also controls a subsidiary in Japan, an agency in South Korea and an agency for Australia and New
	Zealand. All of these offices report to the regional office in Shanghai. The general strategy for the
<I>
	Natuzzi
</I>
	brand is to further expand the store network throughout the region, with a strong emphasis on the Chinese market.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, 71
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	stores were operating in the Asia-Pacific market: 46 in China, 6 each in Australia and
	Taiwan, 3 in Korea, 2 each in Vietnam, Thailand and Singapore, and 1 each in Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines and Hong Kong. In addition, as of the same date, the Group had 84
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	stores located in China (of which 14 were
	operated by the Group). The Group also maintains 15 galleries in the Asia-Pacific region, of which 11 are under the
<I>
	Natuzzi Italia
</I>
	(8 located in Japan, 2 in Thailand, and 1 in Singapore) and 4 under the
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	(3 located in
	Taiwan and 1 Australia).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group is currently planning to further expand its presence in China, specifically with single-brand stores
	located in medium-sized cities across the country.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group relabeled the
<I>
	Leather Editions
</I>
	portfolio of products as
<I>
	Natuzzi
	Editions
</I>
	to capitalize on the strength of the Natuzzi name and streamline its offerings. Consequently, the
<I>
	Leather Editions
</I>
	stores, including those stores located in the Asia Pacific region, China in particular, have been renamed under
	the
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	name.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group continues to search for opportunities for further investment in the Indian market. A local
	representative office was opened in New Delhi in the beginning of 2010 to manage sales, marketing and customer service and supervise the
<I>
	Natuzzi
</I>
	retail roll-out in the Indian market.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	31
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D190845D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<A NAME="D190845D20F_HTM_TOC190845_18">
</A>
	Customer Credit Management
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group maintains an active credit management program.&nbsp;The Group evaluates the creditworthiness of its customers on a case-by-case
	basis according to each customer&#146;s credit history and information available to the Group.&nbsp;Throughout the world, the Group utilizes &#147;open terms&#148; in 84% of its sales and obtains credit insurance for 61% of this amount; less than
	11% of the Group&#146;s sales are commonly made to customers on a &#147;cash against documents&#148; and &#147;cash on delivery&#148; basis; and lastly, about 5% of the Group&#146;s sales are supported by a &#147;letter of credit&#148; or
	&#147;payment in advance.&#148; In July, the Company signed a 5-year non-recourse (
<I>
	pro-soluto
</I>
	) assignment of trade receivables with a major Italian financial company by means of a securitization program. The maximum amount of trade receivable
	that can be sold under this program is &#128;35 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<A NAME="D190845D20F_HTM_TOC190845_19">
</A>
	Incentive Programs and Tax Benefits
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Historically, the Group derived benefits from the Italian Government&#146;s investment incentive program for under-industrialized regions in
	Southern Italy, which includes the area that serves as the center of the Group&#146;s operations.&nbsp;The investment incentive program provides tax benefits, capital grants and subsidized loans. There can be no assurance that the Group will
	continue to be eligible for such grants, benefits or tax credits for its current or future investments in Italy.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In 2006, the Company
	entered into an agreement with the Italian Ministry of Industrial Activities for the incentive program entitled &#147;Integrated Package of Benefits&#151;Innovation of the working national program &#145;Developing Local Entrepreneurs&#146;&#148; for
	the creation of a centralized information system in Santeramo in Colle that will be utilized by all Natuzzi points-of-sale around the world.&nbsp;This agreement anticipated costs of &#128;7.2&nbsp;million and &#128;1.9&nbsp;million for the
	development and industrialization program, respectively.&nbsp;On March&nbsp;20, 2006, the Italian Industrial Ministry issued a concession decree providing for a provisional grant to the Company of &#128;2.8&nbsp;million and a loan of
	&#128;4.3&nbsp;million, to be repaid at a rate of 0.74% over 10 years.&nbsp;Between December 2006 and September 2008, the Company provided the aforementioned Committee with the list of expenses to be recognized under this project and that have been
	incurred between July 2005 and November 2007 (date of completion of the program) totaling &#128;10.8 million.&nbsp;In April 2009, the Italian Government provided, as advance payment, a &#128;3.9&nbsp;million subsidized loan and a
	&#128;1.9&nbsp;million operating subsidy to the Company.&nbsp;These payments were approved in 2010 by the Ministry Committee, and operating subsidies of &#128;0.6&nbsp;million and &#128;0.2&nbsp;million were paid in April 2012 and October 2013,
	respectively, as well as the residual subsidized loan amount of &#128;0.4&nbsp;million in October 2013.&nbsp;The Company is still awaiting receipt of &#128;0.1&nbsp;million of operating grants.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During 2008, the Italian Ministry of Industrial Activities approved a new incentive program, entitled &#147;Made in Italy &#150; Industry
	2015.&#148;&nbsp;The objective of this program is to facilitate the realization and development of new production technologies and services with high innovation value in order to stimulate awareness for products that are made in Italy.&nbsp;In
	December 2008, the Company submitted to the Italian Ministry of Industrial Activities its proposal, entitled &#147;i-sofas.&#148;&nbsp;The &#147;i-sofas&#148; program envisions a total investment of &#128;3.9&nbsp;million, up to
	&#128;1.7&nbsp;million of which may be contributed as a grant by the Italian Ministry of Industrial Activities.&nbsp;In October 2011, the Italian Ministry of Industrial Activities issued a concession decree reducing the total investment from
	&#128;3.9 to &#128;1.9&nbsp;million and, accordingly, capital grants from up to &#128;1.7&nbsp;million to &#128;0.7 million. No capital grant was collected in 2013. The Company collected &#128;0.2&nbsp;million of grants on April&nbsp;1, 2014, and
	&#128;0.1&nbsp;million of grants on December&nbsp;16, 2014.&nbsp;The Company collected &#128;0.1&nbsp;million under this program in September 2015. The Company does not expect to receive any further collection under this program because the Ministry
	did not acknowledge a list of presented expenses for the difference.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In April 2010, Natuzzi S.p.A., as the leader of a coalition of 19
	institutions (including universities, research centers and other industrial companies), submitted to the Italian Ministry of Education, University and Research a project proposal entitled &#147;Future Factory,&#148; which hopes to be financed using
	National Operating Plan (
<I>
	Piano Operativo Nazionale
</I>
	) funds.&nbsp;This project concerns the research and development of technologies and advanced applications for the control, monitoring and management of industrial processes.&nbsp;This project
	anticipates an overall cost of &#128;17.4&nbsp;million, of which Natuzzi is supposed to bear &#128;3.3&nbsp;million (&#128;2.6 million as industrial research-related costs, and &#128;0.7&nbsp;million as experimental activity-related costs). In March
	2011, the Ministry informed the Company that it was included on a short list of companies being considered for the grant. In April 2012 the Ministry approved the Feasibility Study. As of the date of this Annual report the Company has not received an
	update from the Ministry. There can be no guarantee that the Company will receive the aforementioned grant from the Italian Government.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	32
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D190845D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In 2013 The Company took part in a temporary association (
<I>
	Associazione Temporanea di
	Imprese
</I>
	) (&#147;ATI&#148;), under a program called &#147;MAIND&#148;, that aims to share Research, Development and Training expenses that relate to eco-innovative materials and advanced technologies for the manufacturing and construction
	industries.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	By taking part in ATI, the Company hopes to receive grants by the Italian Government covering its investments in the moving
	line of its Italian plants
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In November 2014, The Italian Ministry of Education, University and Research accepted the request for a grant
	from ATI, and in particular, granted Natuzzi S.p.A. &#128;0.6&nbsp;million to cover almost all of its expenses presented under this experimental research and development project. In 2015, the Company, through the company that leads the ATI,
	presented to the Italian Ministry of Economic Development a statement of expenses related to the personnel in the research and development department, as well as training expenses in moving line.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of the date of this Annual Report, the Company has not yet been informed of the timing of collection of such &#128;0.6&nbsp;million grant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In September 2015, the Company presented to the Italian Ministry of Economic Development a &#128;49.7&nbsp;million investment program for
	industrial development, which is composed of six programs, including programs in research and development and for upgrading its Italian facilities located in the Puglia and Basilicata Regions. The Company formally requested that the Italian Ministry
	of Economic Development grant is &#128;37.3&nbsp;million from public incentives. The total amount of &#128;49.7&nbsp;million is composed of &#128;27.7&nbsp;million to upgrade the Italian plants located in Puglia and Basilicata Regions, and the
	remaining part of &#128;22.0&nbsp;million is for innovation, research and development expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The expected grant should be represented
	by &#128;14.0&nbsp;million as a capital grant and by &#128;23.3 as subsidized loan. As of the date of this Annual Report, the request has been accepted by the Italian Ministry for Economic Development. The Company has already started to carry out
	the planned investments. The ministry officers will shortly execute on-the-spot inspections in order to evaluate the feasibility (both technical and financial) of the presented investments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<A NAME="D190845D20F_HTM_TOC190845_20">
</A>
	Management of Exchange Rate Risk
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group is subject to currency exchange rate risk in the ordinary course of its business to the extent that its costs are denominated in
	currencies other than those in which it earns revenues. Exchange rate fluctuations also affect the Group&#146;s operating results because it recognizes revenues and costs in currencies other than Euro but publishes its financial statements in Euro.
	The Group also holds a substantial portion of its cash and cash equivalents in currencies other than the Euro, including a large amount in RMB received as compensation for the relocation of its Chinese manufacturing plant. The Group&#146;s sales and
	results may be materially affected by exchange rate fluctuations. For more information, see &#147;Item 11. Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures about Market Risk.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<A NAME="D190845D20F_HTM_TOC190845_21">
</A>
	Trademarks and Patents
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group&#146;s products are sold under the
<I>
	Natuzzi
</I>
	,
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	,
<I>
	Natuzzi Re-vive
</I>
	,
<I>
	Softaly
</I>
	trademarks.&nbsp;These trademarks and certain other trademarks, such as
<I>
	Leather Editions, Italsofa, Divani&nbsp;&amp; Divani by Natuzzi
</I>
	, have been registered in all jurisdictions in which the Group has a commercial interest, such as Italy,
	the European Union and elsewhere.&nbsp;In order to protect its investments in new product development, the Group has also undertaken the practice of registering certain new designs in most of the countries in which such designs are sold.&nbsp;The
	Group currently has more than 1,000 design patents and patents (registered and pending).&nbsp;Applications are made with respect to new product introductions that the Group believes will enjoy commercial success and have a high likelihood of being
	copied.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Natuzzi Group launched
<I>
	Re-vive
</I>
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	, an innovative armchair that
	was the result of a collaborative effort between Natuzzi&#146;s Style Center and the Formway Design Studio of Wellington, New Zealand. The
<I>
	Re-vive
</I>
	recliner combines style and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	33
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage38"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D190845D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	comfort, Italian artisan expertise and innovative New Zealand design. This innovative armchair is internationally protected by several patents covering both its shape and all of its components.
	In particular, the design&nbsp;patent was filed in 39 countries, while the mechanism patent was filed in 44 countries.&nbsp;Natuzzi has entered into a 20-year licensing agreement, signed in January 2011, with Formway that allows it to utilize the
	design and mechanisms developed for the
<I>
	Re-vive
</I>
	armchair in exchange for a licensing fee, payable in installments, and royalties representing a percentage of sales of the armchair.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As for the distribution of the products that are manufactured in the Group&#146;s plants and identified under various names (
<I>
	Natuzzi
	Italia
</I>
	,
<I>
	Natuzzi Editions
</I>
	,
<I>
	Natuzzi Re-vive
</I>
	), the Group has in place with its customers (retailers and/or wholesalers) business agreements under the form of a sales license (product supply and brand usage license).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Furthermore, the Group also has supply agreements in place with large wholesalers for the supply of private label products that are
	manufactured by the Group&#146;s industrial plants outside of Italy.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<A NAME="D190845D20F_HTM_TOC190845_22">
</A>
	Regulation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company is incorporated under the laws of the Republic of Italy.&nbsp;The principal laws and regulations that apply to the operations of
	the Company&#151;those of Italy and the European Union&#151;are different from those of the United States.&nbsp;Such non-U.S. laws and regulations may be subject to varying interpretations or may be changed, and new laws and regulations may be
	adopted, from time to time.&nbsp;Our products are subject to regulations applicable in the countries where they are manufactured and sold.&nbsp;Our production processes are regularly inspected to ensure compliance with applicable
	regulations.&nbsp;While management believes that the Group is currently in compliance in all material respects with such laws and regulations (including rules with respect to environmental matters), there can be no assurance that any subsequent
	official interpretation of such laws or regulations by the relevant governmental authorities that differs from that of the Company, or any such change or adoption, would not have an adverse effect on the results of operations of the Group or the
	rights of holders of the Ordinary Shares or the owners of the Company&#146;s ADSs.&nbsp;See &#147;Item 4.&nbsp;Information on the Company&#151;Environmental Regulatory Compliance,&#148; &#147;Item 10.&nbsp;Additional Information&#151;Exchange
	Controls&#148; and &#147;Item 10.&nbsp;Additional Information&#151;Taxation.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<A NAME="D190845D20F_HTM_TOC190845_23">
</A>
	Environmental Regulatory
	Compliance
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group, to the best of its knowledge, operates all of its facilities in compliance with all applicable laws and
	regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<A NAME="D190845D20F_HTM_TOC190845_24">
</A>
	Insurance
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group maintains insurance against a number of risks. The Group insures against loss or damage to its facilities, loss or damage to its
	products while in transit to customers, failure to recover receivables, certain potential environmental liabilities, product liability claims and Directors and Officer Liabilities. While the Group&#146;s insurance does not cover 100% of these risks,
	management believes that the Group&#146;s present level of insurance is adequate in light of past experience
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	34
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	35
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D190845D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Capital expenditures during the last three years were primarily made to make improvements to
	property, plant and equipment and for the expansion of the Company&#146;s retail network. In 2015, capital expenditures were primarily made to make improvements at the Group&#146;s existing facilities, in particular in Italy for the implementation
	of the moving line production process.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group expects that capital expenditures in 2016 will range from &#128;14.0&nbsp;million to
	&#128;16.0&nbsp;million, which is expected to be financed through the improved cash flow from operations, bank facilities and through new credit lines pursuant to a new agreement with the Ministry of Economic Development (
<I>
	Ministero dello Sviluppo
	Economico
</I>
	) and the governments of the Puglia and Basilicata regions, dated September&nbsp;23, 2015 (the &#147;Developing Contract&#148;). The Developing Contract consists of an incentive program for upholstery furniture divisions, which is aimed
	at recovering competiveness of Italian companies. According to the Developing Contract, in the next three years the company will invest &#128;49.7&nbsp;million (of which &#128;27.7&nbsp;million is related to upgrading Italian facilities and
	&#128;22.0&nbsp;million is for research and development expenses). MISE, Puglia and Basilicata Regions will contribute an amount up to &#128;37.3&nbsp;million (of which up to &#128;14.0&nbsp;million as government grants and up to
	&#128;23.3&nbsp;million as subsidized loan). In 2016 the Company plans to invest approximately &#128;12&nbsp;million for this program and expects to receive an amount of up to &#128;5.0&nbsp;million as government support related to this program. The
	Group believes that liquidity deriving from its operation activities is sufficient to cover such capital expenditures even in the event of partial or total absence of government support of such &#147;developing program&#148;.
</P>
</EFX_COMPANY_INFORMATION>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following discussion of the Group&#146;s results of operations, liquidity and capital
	resources is based on information derived from the audited Consolidated Financial Statements and the notes thereto included in Item&nbsp;18 of this Annual Report. These financial statements have been prepared in accordance with Italian GAAP, which
	differ in certain respects from U.S. GAAP. For a discussion of the principal differences between Italian GAAP and U.S. GAAP as they relate to the Group&#146;s consolidated net losses and shareholders&#146; equity, see Note 31 to the Consolidated
	Financial Statements included in Item&nbsp;18 of this Annual Report. All information that is not historical in nature and disclosed under &#147;Item 5&#151;Operating and Financial Review and Prospects&#148; is deemed to be a forward-looking
	statement. See &#147;Item 3. Key Information&#151;Forward Looking Information.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<A NAME="D190845D20F_HTM_TOC190845_29">
</A>
	Critical Accounting
	Policies and estimates
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Use of Estimates &#151;
</B>
	The significant accounting policies used by the Group to prepare its financial
	statements are described in Note 3 to the Consolidated Financial Statements included in Item&nbsp;18 of this Annual Report. The application of these policies requires management to make estimates, judgments and assumptions that are subjective and
	complex, and which affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities as of any reporting date and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during any reporting period. The Group&#146;s financial results could be materially different if
	different estimates, judgments or assumptions were used. The following discussion addresses the estimates, judgments and assumptions that the Group considers most material based on the degree of uncertainty and the likelihood of a material impact if
	a different estimate, judgment or assumption were used. Actual results could differ from such estimates, due to, among other things, uncertainty, lack or limited availability of information, variations in economic inputs such as prices, costs, and
	other significant factors including the matters described under &#147;Risk Factors.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Long-lived Assets &#151;
</B>
	Management
	reviews long-lived assets for impairment whenever changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of the assets may not be recoverable and would record an impairment charge if necessary. Recoverability of
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	36
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D190845D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	assets to be held and used is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of an asset to the recoverable amount, which is the higher of the estimated fair value less cost to sell of future
	undiscounted and discounted net cash flows expected to be generated by the asset and are significantly impacted by estimates of future prices for our products, capital needs, economic trends and other factors. If the carrying value of a long-lived
	asset is considered impaired, an impairment charge is recorded for the amount by which the carrying value of the long-lived asset exceeds its estimated recoverable amount, in relation to its use or realization, as determined by reference to the most
	recent corporate plans. The Company analyzes its overall valuation and performs an impairment analysis of its long-lived assets in accordance with Italian GAAP and U.S. GAAP (long-lived assets have to be tested for impairment whenever the events or
	changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may be not recoverable).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Due to a market capitalization that falls
	below the carrying amount of the company, and history of operating loss and revenues decline, management has performed impairment tests on certain long-lived assets where losses have been generated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The fair value analysis of each long-lived asset in use is unique and requires that management use estimates and assumptions that are deemed
	prudent and reasonable for a particular set of circumstances. Management believes that the estimates used in the analyses are reasonable; however, changes in estimates could affect the relevant valuations and the recoverability of the carrying
	values of the assets. The cash flows employed in our 2015 undiscounted and discounted cash flow analyses for impairment analysis of long lived assets in use were based on the Business Plan 2014-2016, adopted by the Board of Directors on
	February&nbsp;28, 2014, as updated by management for the period 2017-2020 to reflect the roll-forward of the Plan in the next years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	While management believes its estimates are reasonable, many of these matters involve significant uncertainty, and actual results may differ
	from the estimates used. The key inputs and assumptions that were used in performing the 2015 impairment test for long-lived assets in use are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
